titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Thomas Harrison military records 1977.417
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-11T15:14-0500

did.abstract: This collection contains records relating to the 137th Regiment of the New York State Militia, based in the town of Huntington, Long Island and led by Major and Lieutenant Colonel Thomas Harrison. Items mostly include orders instructing officers to prepare their soldiers for various military parades, including lists of soldiers to be called, and reports on delinquent soldiers who were absent from the parades. Other documents pertain to a court-martial proceeding for delinquent soldiers, which Thomas Harrison conducted. All items date from 1826.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Thomas Harrison military records, 1977.417, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
